briefdescription.para: Flip the image horizontally.
Flip the image vertically.
Flip operation types.
Keep the lightness of the color, drops the saturation.
Grayscale by perceptual luminosity (weighted sum of color RGB components)
Grayscale by taking average of color RGB components.
No change.
Modes for converting a QImage to grayscale.
Alter the brightness or contrast of a QImage.

parameterdescription.para: brightness value, in the range -255 to 255. A brightness value of 0 indicates no change to brightness, a negative value will darken the image, and a positive value will brighten the image.

contrast value. Must be a positive or zero value. A value of 1.0 indicates no change to the contrast, a value of 0 represents an image with 0 contrast, and a value > 1.0 will increase the contrast of the image.

memberdef.argsstring: (QImage &image, double saturation, const QColor &colorizeColor=QColor(), double colorizeStrength=1.0)
memberdef.name: adjustHueSaturation

briefdescription.para: Alter the hue or saturation of a QImage.

parameterdescription.para: double between 0 and 2 inclusive, where 0 = desaturate and 1.0 = no change
color to use for colorizing image. Set to an invalid QColor to disable colorization.
double between 0 and 1, where 0 = no colorization and 1.0 = full colorization

briefdescription.para: Convert a QImage to a grayscale image.

detaileddescription.para:
Alpha channel is preserved.
image
QImage to convert
mode
mode to use during grayscale conversion

briefdescription.para: Crop any transparent border from around an image.

parameterdescription.para: minimum size for cropped image, if desired. If the cropped image is smaller than the minimum size, it will be centered in the returned image.
cropped image will be centered on the center of the original image if set to true

briefdescription.para: Performs a distance transform on the source image and shades the result using a color ramp.

parameterdescription.para: DistanceTransformProperties object with parameters for the distance transform operation

briefdescription.para: Flips an image horizontally or vertically.

parameterdescription.para: type of flip to perform (horizontal or vertical)

briefdescription.para: Performs a gaussian blur on an image.

detaileddescription.para:
Gaussian blur is slower but results in a high quality blur.
image
QImage to blur
radius
blur radius in pixels
blurred image
for fastest operation, ensure the source image is ARGB32_Premultiplied

briefdescription.para: Multiplies opacity of image pixel values by a factor.

parameterdescription.para: factor to multiple pixel's opacity by

briefdescription.para: Calculates the non-transparent region of an image.

parameterdescription.para: minimum size for returned region, if desired. If the non-transparent region of the image is smaller than this minimum size, it will be centered in the returned rectangle.
return rectangle will be centered on the center of the original image if set to true

briefdescription.para: Overlays a color onto an image.

detaileddescription.para:
This operation retains the alpha channel of the original image, but replaces all image pixel colors with the specified color.
image
QImage to alter
color
color to overlay (any alpha component of the color is ignored)

briefdescription.para: Performs a stack blur on an image.

detaileddescription.para:
Stack blur represents a good balance between speed and blur quality.
image
QImage to blur
radius
blur radius in pixels, maximum value of 16
alphaOnly
set to true to blur only the alpha component of the image
for fastest operation, ensure the source image is ARGB32_Premultiplied if alphaOnly is set to false, or ARGB32 if alphaOnly is true

briefdescription.para: Contains operations and filters which apply to QImages.

detaileddescription.para: A set of optimised pixel manipulation operations and filters which can be applied to QImages. All operations only apply to ARGB32 format images, and it is left up to the calling procedure to ensure that any passed images are of the correct format.
Operations are written to either modify an image in place or return a new image, depending on which is faster for the particular operation.
